title: Waukegan police searching for 18-year-old murder suspect
content:
Waukegan police are searching for an 18-year-old murder suspect.
On Nov. 14, Waukegan police department’s Criminal Investigations Division obtained an arrest warrant for first-degree murder for Willie C. Jackson, according to Waukegan police. The arrest warrant carries a $3,000,000 bond.
Jackson is believed to have left north suburban Waukegan and is in now in the Chicago area.
About 8:30 p.m. Nov. 11, officers responded to a call for a shooting at home in the 400 block of McKinley Avenue, police said.
When officers arrived they located a victim that had been shot in a common area of the home at the base of a staircase, police said. The victim had been identified as 17-year-old Dayviontay T. Jackson, who was pronounced dead at the scene.
Detectives who are investigating the murder believe it stemmed from a verbal argument that escalated into the shooting, police said.
Although the weapon from the incident was recovered the night of the murder, Jackson is considered armed and dangerous, police said.
Anyone with information on Jackson’s whereabouts should contact the Waukegan police department’s Tip-Line at (847) 360-9001.
